1040698874497622021.text:
Should VR/AR apps feature gravity in their UI? Yes! But differently.

In the real world, gravity pulls everything down. But in VR/AR UX, each UI element can have its own form of gravity, thus attracting all relevant surrounding elements to it.

Redesign physics to suit your app!

964935850462097409.text:
VR has a locomotion problem: and we fix it is by redesigning space, not motion.

In the physical world, we use space to spread out information and locomotion to access it. But in VR, space can be bent and transformed.

Rethink the role of space - and locomotion will be trivial.

(2) Vive Pro wireless may not work with Leap Motion due to bandwidth and compression.

Things that happened in the mirror universe:
1. Nelson Mandela died in prison
2. Shazaam, starring Sinbad
3. The BerenSTEIN Bears
4. Leap Motion had a Kickstarter

1022522188870688769.text: What's needed is a new spirit of exploration – of uncovering the unexpected and being open to strange possibilities. Augmented reality can do this for us, but only if we design it that way.

1022521893432307716.text: Our lives are dominated by feeds curated to appeal to our narrow interests. This helps us to navigate an unfathomable amount of noise, but at the same time makes us narrower as people.

1022521564485562379.text: It's not just about making things easier or more efficient, but also making the things we focus on more meaningful. If technology is the "bicycle of the mind," it's not enough to be able to go places faster – it's also about being able to go more places.

1022521376505307137.text: The best possible future is one that not only makes us more powerful but also challenges us in new ways. Augmented reality has an unprecedented ability to narrowcast to users – which can either reinforce their prejudices or expose them to things unexpected and new.

1012345746459430912.text: You asked, we delivered! This morning, we released an update to the North Star headset assembly. The project CAD files now fit the Leap Motion Controller and add support for alternate headgear and torsion spring hinges: http://blog.leapmotion.com/project-north-star-mechanical-update-1/ …https://twitter.com/LeapMotion/status/1007656216963796992 …

1011370409311264769.text:
Q: Is this real??
A: Sometimes we ask ourselves the same question. But yes. We even open sourced it:https://developer.leapmotion.com/northstar

1011370385974153217.text:
Q: Can you feel the ball hit?
A: We didn't build force feedback into the paddle but it wouldn't be terribly difficult. That being said, you might be surprised what your brain fills in when you have sight and sound.

1011370352965029888.text:
Q: Is it tethered to a PC?
A: The AR headset currently requires a PC, though in principle it can be run on a mobile processor. We haven't optimized in that direction just yet – enough challenges to figure out without having to account for a small processing budget.

1011370221922340865.text:
Q: Do the people who made this have friends?
A: We do! There's a multiplayer version and it's a blast, but sometimes you have code compiling and your friend is still elbow-deep in a prototype with a soldering gun.

1011370174925213697.text: Ultimately we want to create new kinds of experiences that are difficult or impossible to have in the real world. Playing table tennis with an imaginary ball against an embodied AI is a tiny step in that direction.

1011370142901645314.text: The table tennis demo also demonstrates a key concept which is largely unexplored: artificial skills training for real-world scenarios. As we’ve seen with chess, with AI we can always have an opponent who sharpens our skills and pushes us to be better.

1011370111607943169.text:
Q: No really, why table tennis? 
A: We wanted to show how emerging technologies – #AR, #AI, hand tracking, and a smart object – can flow together into a single experience.

1011370069631426561.text:
Q: Why not just buy a $0.25 ball?
A: We were tired of fishing the ball from under the couch.
